page.title: 03GARBOLDISHAM.
page.content: Garboldisham,{(GARBLESHAM),}possibly originated as "Garibaldi's Hame", Garibaldi being a Dane. Prewar the Montgomrie family owned the scattered group of numbered and landed estate cottages which sold for Â£48000 in 1944. There is now a mix of old and new with names and numbers in cheerful chaos. There is an unobtrusive modern {ESTATE}but other dwellings are strung out like a looped necklace, bounded by pasture and farmland. Six clay lump council houses are to be redeveloped. School, Church, V.Hall and Pub. are centrally located. The village (600+) is quartered by intersecting roads (A1066,B1111) but remains well integrated. Local groups flourish, making good use of two halls. Part of the village comes into a{CONSERVATION area and there is a rigid{'BUILDING {ENVELOPE'}which limits development.
